title: People abusing you, and not being a team player.
body:
I'm sick and tired of these people no matter their age - who find it necessary to belittle you, or your family members, and who don't stick to the gameplan/positions.

Example: If someone calls a position first, they get it - right?
WRONG!
I've been calling Jg/Jungle - and I seem to have others that lock in heroes, and so on which makes me change my position and so on because I don't want to waste my time playing a game that we aren't going to win or stand a good chance at winning.

Can you implement a new system where you have to select your position, and if it's wrong - or someone does the 'unsportsmanlike' thing. That they should be banned from the game for a period of time?
Or something. Because it's driving me insane!

Just got to be a douche don't you?

Regardless, i agree the normal system needs to have it implemented if Riot wants to keep its casual players content and expect them to spend money on the game.

Hey Summoner

A little while back **Riot** developed the new champion select to deal with this issue. In the new champion select you can select your 2 primary roles and be guaranteed them every time you queue.

Sadly you can only use this new champion select in ranked on OCE, since draft pick normals have not been enabled yet. It doesn't look like we'll have draft pick normals anytime soon either according to **Riot Sephyre**.

> [{quoted}](name=Sephyre,realm=OCE,application-id=3fteLeTW,discussion-id=VdoPT9GX,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-04-11T00:58:27.786+0000)
>
> Normal Draft is not likely to be opened up anytime soon. That said, we do evaluate for it, and if we grow to the point of being able to support it we would open it up.

As of right now your best option is to reach level 30 and queue in ranked with the new champion select system.

Alternatively, You could play constantly with four friends. Playing as a 5 will definitely lessen your chances of being matched with trollers/afks/other toxins. It also allows you to become familiar with the play patterns of your teammates (so you don't have to keep adjusting your style every game) and you have way better communication. There is literally no reason not to. You also get lots of cool bonuses like extra IP, mastery points and Hextech stuff ♥
